user_flow.title: Pizza Discovery
user_flow.description: Users can discover new pizza combinations through an automated recommendation system with customizable parameters including calorie limits, topping counts, dietary restrictions, tool exclusions, and custom naming options.

summary: Successfully tested the Pizza Discovery functionality through the automated recommendation system. The system works correctly - clicking the 'Pizza, Please!' button generates unique pizza recommendations with detailed information (name, dough type, ingredients, tool, calories). The feedback system is functional with both 'Love it!' and 'No thanks' buttons properly recording user ratings (displaying 'Rated!' confirmation). The system demonstrates variety by generating three different pizza combinations: The Light Pugliese (500 cal, thick dough, knife), The Mushy Prosciutto (250 cal, thick dough, pizza cutter), and The Mammoth Margherita (800 cal, stuffed dough, pizza cutter). All aspects of the user flow for discovering new pizza combinations work as expected.

summary: Found a critical bug with the Pizza Rating Management functionality. The 'Clear Ratings' button does not work as expected - it fails to clear the user's pizza ratings data. When clicked, it only scrolls the page to the top without removing any ratings. The user can successfully view their pizza ratings history (54 ratings total from Rating ID 1 to 54), but the clear functionality is completely broken. This prevents users from managing their ratings data properly.

summary: Found significant bugs in the Advanced Settings functionality. While some features work correctly (custom pizza name and vegetarian setting), critical settings like 'Excluded Tools' and 'Max Calories per Slice' are not being properly applied. The excluded tools list shows 'Knife' as excluded, but the generated pizza recommendation uses 'Knife' as the tool. The calorie limit setting is also not being enforced as the recommendation shows 1550 calories per slice, which exceeds the configured limit. Additionally, the input fields have a usability issue where typing new values appends to existing values instead of replacing them.

From the Login/Profile section, users can navigate back using the 'Back to main page' link at the bottom of the ratings page. From the Advanced section, users can return to the main page view by toggling off the Advanced settings switch. Both navigation methods work correctly and properly return users to the main page functionality.
